net.sourceforge.JDash.gui
Class ButtonGauge

java.lang.Object
  net.sourceforge.JDash.gui.AbstractGauge
      net.sourceforge.JDash.gui.ButtonGauge
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener, java.util.Observer
public class ButtonGauge
extends AbstractGauge
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener

This gauge is designed to put a button on the screen. The button can be a user controllable button, or a sensor controllable button. If the parameter is a null parameter, then the button will be only user controllable. If the parameter is set, then it will be parameter controllable.

update

public void update(java.util.Observable obs,
                   java.lang.Object obj)
We need to trap the update message, to watch for value changes so we can trip the button. Override

Specified by:
update in interface java.util.Observer
Overrides:
update in class AbstractGauge
Parameters:
obs - IN - the observable paramerer. This object is not used since this gauge can only respond to one parameter anyway.
obj - IN - the extra object value. This is also not normally used except for when a GaugePanel resize event occurs. the gauge panel will call update() on all gauges, passing a Boolean.TRUE into the obj param.
See Also:
AbstractGauge.update(java.util.Observable, java.lang.Object)

preGenerate

public java.awt.Rectangle preGenerate(java.awt.geom.AffineTransform scalingTransform,
                                      boolean force)
Override

Specified by:
preGenerate in class AbstractGauge
Parameters:
scalingTransform - IN - the scaling transform that will be passed into the paint() method.
force - IN - force a preGen. In other words, when this is set, you should NOT be returning a null rect.
Returns:
the bounds rectangle. If a null is returned, then this gaugae will not cause a repaint. It will be assumed that a null means that nothing has changed, and a redraw is not needed.
See Also:
net.sourceforge.JDash.gui.AbstractGauge#getBounds()

paint

public void paint(java.awt.Graphics2D g2,
                  java.awt.geom.AffineTransform scalingTransform)
Override does nothing. Just returns.

Specified by:
paint in class AbstractGauge
Parameters:
g2 - IN - the graphics context to draw with.
scalingTransform - IN - the tranform to apply that will adjust to the size of the parent panel. This is the same transform that would be returned if calling getParent().getScalingTransform()
